Trigger System for Line-Scan Cameras

Overview
.

Description
.

The trigger system for line-scan cameras consits of two separate units, the Line Trigger and the Image Trigger for line-scan cameras. Please mind the difference of the 'Image Trigger for line-scan cameras' and the 'Area Trigger for area-scan cameras'.

The Line Trigger is in charge to control the camera, wheras the Image Trigger is resposible to group the acquired lines into images. This mechanism is increasing the performance of your frame grabber, since the block transfer to your PC via DMA is operating on these virtual images and therefore using less DMA requests.

Therefore, the Line Trigger is generating signals (Exsync and Exsync2) which can be mapped onto CC signals and control the generation of lines by the camera. E.g. the exposure time, the line frequency or the synchonisation to an external trigger signal are managed by the Line Trigger.

The Image Trigger controlls the grouping of lines into images, but can also suppress the generation of external line triggers (Exsync and Exsync2) during intervals, when no image is acquired.
